info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 6 at 7:34AM CDT until April 6 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Pickens.
* WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aliceville, Gordo, Reform, Carrollton, Pickensville, Ethelsville, Memphis, McMullen, Johnston Lake, Garden, Benevola, Bevill Lock And Dam, Owens, Dillburg, McShan, North Pickens Airport, Macedonia, George Downer Airport, Kirk and Shaw.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
